properties.name: scroll-snap-type
properties.value: none | [ x | y | block | inline | both ] [ mandatory | proximity ]?

values.name: x
values.prose: The scroll container snaps to snap positions in its horizontal axis only.

values.name: y
values.prose: The scroll container snaps to snap positions in its vertical axis only.

values.name: block
values.prose: The scroll container snaps to snap positions in its block axis only.

values.name: inline
values.prose: The scroll container snaps to snap positions in its inline axis only.

values.name: both
values.prose: The scroll container snaps to snap positions in both of its axes independently (potentially snapping to different elements in each axis).

values.name: none
values.prose: If specified on a scroll container, the scroll container must not snap.

values.name: mandatory
values.prose: If specified on a scroll container, the scroll container is required to be snapped to a snap position when there are no active scrolling operations. If a valid snap position exists then the scroll container must snap at the termination of a scroll (if none exist then no snapping occurs).

values.name: proximity
values.prose: If specified on a scroll container, the scroll container may snap to a snap position at the termination of a scroll, at the discretion of the UA given the parameters of the scroll.

properties.name: scroll-padding
properties.percentages: relative to the corresponding dimension of the scroll container’s scrollport
properties.computedValue: per side, either the keyword auto or a computed <length-percentage> value

values.name: <length-percentage [0,∞]>
values.prose: Defines an inward offset from the corresponding edge of the scrollport. When applied to the root viewport, the offset is calculated and applied relative to the layout viewport (rather than the visual viewport) the same way as the corresponding inset properties on fixed-positioned boxes; the optimal viewing region is the remaining area that intersects with the visual viewport.

values.name: auto
values.prose: Indicates that the offset for the corresponding edge of the scrollport is UA-determined. This should generally default to a used length of 0px, but UAs may use heuristics to detect when a non-zero value is more appropriate. For example, a UA could detect when a position:fixed element is being used as an opaque unscrollable “header” that obscures the content below it, and resolve the top offset to the height of that element so that a “page down” operation (such as pressing PgDn) automatically scrolls by one “visible page” of content.

values.name: none
values.prose: This box does not define a snap position in the specified axis.

values.name: start
values.prose: Start alignment of this box’s scroll snap area within the scroll container’s snapport is a snap position in the specified axis.

values.name: end
values.prose: End alignment of this box’s scroll snap area within the scroll container’s snapport is a snap position in the specified axis.

values.name: center
values.prose: Center alignment of this box’s scroll snap area within the scroll container’s snapport is a snap position in the specified axis.

values.name: normal
values.prose: The scroll container may pass over a snap position defined by this element during the execution of a scrolling operation.

values.name: always
values.prose: The scroll container must not pass over a snap position defined by this element during the execution of a scrolling operation; it must instead snap to the first of this element’s snap positions.

properties.name: scroll-padding-top
properties.percentages: relative to the scroll container’s scrollport
properties.computedValue: the keyword auto or a computed <length-percentage> value

properties.name: scroll-padding-right
properties.percentages: relative to the scroll container’s scrollport
properties.computedValue: the keyword auto or a computed <length-percentage> value

properties.name: scroll-padding-bottom
properties.percentages: relative to the scroll container’s scrollport
properties.computedValue: the keyword auto or a computed <length-percentage> value

properties.name: scroll-padding-left
properties.percentages: relative to the scroll container’s scrollport
properties.computedValue: the keyword auto or a computed <length-percentage> value

properties.percentages: relative to the scroll container’s scrollport
properties.computedValue: the keyword auto or a computed <length-percentage> value
